gospels_overview.matthew: Gospel of the King: Parables, Sermon on the Mount, fulfillment of OT prophecy.
gospels_overview.mark: Gospel of the Servant: Miracles, fast-paced action, suffering Messiah.
gospels_overview.luke: Gospel of the Man: Parables of compassion, women, poor; historical detail.
gospels_overview.john: Gospel of the Son of God: Signs, I AM statements, eternal life.

sower.kjv: Matthew 13:3-23: Behold, a sower went forth to sow; And when he sowed, some seeds fell by the way side, and the fowls came and devoured them up: Some fell upon stony places, where they had not much earth: and forthwith they sprung up, because they had no deepness of earth: And when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away. And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprung up, and choked them: But other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit, some an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold. ... [Full explanation: Path = Satan steals, rocky = withers under persecution, thorns = choked by worries, good soil = bears fruit]. (Also Mark 4:3-20, Luke 8:5-15)
sower.greek_original: Παραβολή (parabolē) = 'comparison'. Key Greek: σπείρων (speirōn, sower), σπέρμα (sperma, seed), καρποφόρος (karpophoros, fruitful). From Nestle-Aland NT: 'ἰδοὺ ἐξῆλθεν ὁ σπείρων τοῦ σπεῖραι... [full Greek from Matthew 13 via Berean Interlinear].'
sower.deep_wide: Teaches heart conditions for receiving God's Word. Historical: 1st-century Palestinian farming (rocky soil Galilee). Archaeology: Qumran scrolls show seed metaphors in Dead Sea texts. Cross-ref: Isaiah 55:10-11 (Word as seed/rain).

mustard_seed.kjv: Matthew 13:31-32: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field: Which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof. (Also Mark 4:30-32, Luke 13:18-19)
mustard_seed.greek_original: Κόκκῳ σινάπεως (kokkō sinapeōs, grain of mustard). Full Greek: 'ὁμοία ἐστὶν ἡ βασιλεία τῶν οὐρανῶν κόκκῳ σινάπεως... [from NA28].'
mustard_seed.deep_wide: Kingdom starts small, grows vast. Historical: Mustard plants in Galilee grow 10ft tall. Archaeology: Mustard seeds found in 1st-century Herodian jars at Qumran. Cross-ref: Ezekiel 17:22-24 (exalted tree), Daniel 4 (kingdom as tree).

prodigal_son.kjv: Luke 15:11-32: And he said, A certain man had two sons: And the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth to me. And he divided unto them his living. And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living. ... [Full story of repentance, father's forgiveness, elder brother's jealousy].
prodigal_son.greek_original: Υἱὸς ἀσώτος (huios asōtos, wasteful son). Full: 'ἀνὴρ τις εἶχεν δύο υἱούς... [from Luke 15 NA28].'
prodigal_son.deep_wide: God's forgiving love. Historical: 1st-century inheritance laws (younger got 1/3). Archaeology: Roman villas in Galilee show prodigal lifestyle. Cross-ref: Hosea 11 (God's compassion), Romans 8:15-17 (adoption as sons).

good_samaritan.kjv: Luke 10:30-37: A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, which stripped him of his raiment, and wounded him, and departed, leaving him half dead. And by chance there came down a certain priest that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side. And likewise a Levite... But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he had compassion on him... [full mercy story].
good_samaritan.greek_original: Σαμαρείτης τις (Samaréitēs tis, certain Samaritan). Full Greek from Luke 10.
good_samaritan.deep_wide: Neighborly love across enemies. Historical: Jerusalem-Jericho road known for bandits. Archaeology: Samaritan Pentateuch manuscripts at Mount Gerizim. Cross-ref: Leviticus 19:18 (love neighbor).

archaeology.nazareth: Village excavated (2009): 1st-century houses, no synagogues, confirming small town. Pottery, tools show poor Jewish settlement.
archaeology.capernaum: Synagogue foundations (1st-century black basalt under later white limestone). Peter's house: graffiti with 'Jesus' inscriptions.
archaeology.jerusalem_temple: Western Wall (Wailing Wall) — retaining wall of Herod's Temple. Temple Mount excavations show 1st-century steps, mikvehs, destruction layer from 70 AD.
archaeology.golgotha: Church of Holy Sepulchre — 1st-century tomb, crucifixion site. Gordon's Calvary alternative with skull-like hill.

culture.galilee: Rural, Jewish, Aramaic-speaking. Synagogues as community centers. Fishing on Sea of Galilee (Peter's trade).
culture.roman_rule: Under Herod Antipas, Roman taxes, centurions. Crucifixion as Roman punishment.
culture.religious: Pharisees (law experts), Sadducees (temple elite), Essenes (Qumran scrolls). Parables target hypocrisy, mercy over ritual.
